mdq:check.description: Check that an attribute domain is defined where necessary.
mdq:check.code:
def call(): global output global status
import java.util.ArrayList as ArrayList import metadig.variable as mvar
# Check if a measurementScale is present for each attribute.
if not attributesPresent: output = "No attributes present that require a measurement domain, check skipped." status = "SKIP" return True
attributeCount = 0 missing = []
for i in range(0, len(attributeDomain)): attributeCount += 1 domain = attributeDomain.get(i) name = attributeName.get(i) # No domain for this attribute was specified if(domain == None or len(domain) == 0): missing.append(name) else: # Note: there may be more that one value returned for the domain, i.e for ISO the min and max values are returned if(mvar.isBlank(domain)): missing.append(name) else: continue
if(len(missing) > 0): output = "The following attributes do not have a domain specified: '{}'".format(', '.join(missing)) status = "FAILURE" return False else: output = "All {} attributes that require a domain have one efined".format(attributeCount) status = "SUCCESS" return True
